description: From French zygotène, corresponding to zyg- 'union, zygosis' (from Ancient Greek ζυγόν (zugón, “junction, yoke”)) + -tene 'filament' (from ταινία (tainía, “band, fillet”)).
Coined by Victor Grégoire in 1907 and in English by Edmund B. Wilson in 1912.

entries.meaning: (biology) The intimate pairing of homologous chromosomes during the synaptic stage of meiosis
